info.title: CMS Media Bridge
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Create an app that uses this API to add video objects to HubSpot. The video object can then be tracked over time, including creating CRM timeline events that show when a customer has watched the video.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the media bridge API to send media objects and media consumption data into HubSpot.

get.description: Get the visibility settings for media bridge events for your apps.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The appId for the media bridge app. It is possible to have multiple apps in your developer account that use the media bridge.

Create a batch of properties of the specified object type.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: The type of object to create the properties for.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The appId for the media bridge app. It is possible to have multiple apps in your developer account that use the media bridge.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

category.description: The main category of the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

favoritedOrder.description: Deprecated. The order position when marked as favorited.

readOnlyValue.description: Indicates if the property's value is read-only.

hidden.description: Whether or not the property will be hidden from the HubSpot UI. It's recommended that this be set to false for custom properties.

optionSortStrategy.description: Specifies how to sort property options. Can be either "DISPLAY_ORDER" to defer to the displayOrder field, or "ALPHABETICAL".

displayOrder.description: The position of the item relative to others in the list.

description.description: A summary of the property's purpose.

showCurrencySymbol.description: Whether to show the currency symbol in HubSpot's UI.

type.description: The data type of the property, such as string or number.

readOnlyDefinition.description: Whether the property's description is read-only.

hubspotDefined.description: A boolean value set to true for HubSpot default properties.

allowedObjectTypes.description: Object types permitted to use this property.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the property was created, in ISO 8601 format.

textDisplayHint.description: Hint for how the text is displayed and validated in HubSpot's UI. Can be: "unformatted_single_line", "multi_line", "email", "phone_number", "domain_name", "ip_address", "physical_address", or "postal_code".

portalId.description: The ID of the HubSpot account where the property is defined.

options.description: A list of valid options for the property. This field is required for enumerated properties.

isPartial.description: For default properties, whether the property has been customized. Equivalent to the 'isCustomizedDefault' field.

optionsAreMutable.description: Whether options can be modified after creation.

hasUniqueValue.description: Whether the property is a unique identifier property.

calculated.description: Whether the property is a calculated field.

externalOptions.description: Applicable only for enumeration type properties. Should be set to true with a 'referencedObjectType' of 'OWNER'. Otherwise false.

favorited.description: Deprecated. Whether the property is marked as a favorite.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the property was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

createdUserId.description: The ID of the user who created the property.

fromUserId.description: The ID of the user who last updated the property.

mutableDefinitionNotDeletable.description: Whether the property definition can be customized but not deleted.

isMultiValued.description: Whether the property can contain multiple values.

sensitiveDataCategories.description: When sensitiveData is true, lists the type of sensitive data contained in the property (e.g., "HIPAA").

currencyPropertyName.description: The name of the related currency property.

isCustomizedDefault.description: For default properties, whether the property has been customized. Equivalent to the 'isCustomizedDefault' field.

label.description: The display label for the property.

formField.description: Whether the property can appear on forms.

displayMode.description: The mode in which the property is displayed. Can be: "current_value" or "all_unique_versions".

dataSensitivity.description: Indicates the sensitivity level of the property, such as "non_sensitive", "sensitive", or "highly_sensitive".

groupName.description: The name of the group to which the property is assigned.

deleted.description: Whether the property has been deleted.

name.description: The internal name for the property.

searchableInGlobalSearch.description: Whether the property is searchable globaly.

externalOptionsReferenceType.description: When externalOptions is true, indicates the property's option values will be populated from other systems (e.g., "OWNER" for the hubspot_owner_id property).

numberDisplayHint.description: Hint for how a number property is displayed and validated in HubSpot's UI. Can be: "unformatted", "formatted", "currency", "percentage", "duration", or "probability".

fieldType.description: Determines how the property will appear in HubSpot's UI or on a form. Learn more in the properties API guide.

associationCategory.description: The category of the association, such as "HUBSPOT_DEFINED".

associationTypeId.description: The ID representing the specific type of association.

AssociationSpec.description: Defines the type, direction, and details of the relationship between two CRM objects.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the association was created, in ISO 8601 format.

fromObjectTypeId.description: The ID of the source object type (e.g., 0-1 for contacts).

name.description: For labeled association types, the internal name of the association.

id.description: The unique ID of the associated object (e.g., a contact ID).

toObjectTypeId.description: The ID of the destination object type (e.g., 0-3 for deals).

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the last update was made to an association, in ISO 8601 format.

contactId.description: The ID of the contact in HubSpots system that consumed the media. This can be fetched using HubSpot's Get contact by usertoken (utk) API. The API also supports supplying a usertoken, and will handle converting this into a contact ID automatically.

rawData.description: This is the raw data which provides the most granular data about spans of the media, and how many times each span was consumed by the user. For example, for a 10 second video where each second is a span, if a visitor watches the first 5 seconds of the video, then restarts the video and watches the first 2 seconds again, the resulting `rawDataString` would be `0=2;1=2;2=1;3=1;4=1;5=0;6=0;7=0;8=0;9=0;`.

pageId.description: The ID of the page, if hosted on HubSpot. Required for HubSpot pages.

pageName.description: The name of the page. Required if the page is not hosted on HubSpot.

occurredTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which this event occurred, in milliseconds since the epoch.

portalId.description: The ID of the HubSpot account.

totalPercentPlayed.description: The percent of the media that the user consumed. Providers may calculate this differently depending on how they consider repeated views of the same portion of media. For this reason, the API will not attempt to validate totalPercentWatched against the attention span information for the event. If it is missing, HubSpot will calculate this from the attention span map as follows: (number of spans with a value of 1 or more)/(Total number of spans).

totalSecondsPlayed.description: The seconds that a user spent consuming the media. The media bridge calculates this as `totalPercentPlayed`*`mediaDuration`. If a provider would like this to be calculated differently, they can provide the pre-calculated value when they create the event.

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page that an event happened on. Required if the page is not hosted on HubSpot.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

contactId.description: The ID of the contact in HubSpots system that consumed the media. This can be fetched using HubSpot's Get contact by usertoken (utk) API. The API also supports supplying a usertoken, and will handle converting this into a contact ID automatically.

pageId.description: The content ID of the page that an event happened on, for HubSpot pages. Required if the page is a HubSpot page.

pageName.description: The name or title of the page that an event happened on. Required for non-HubSpot pages.

portalId.description: The ID of the HubSpot account.

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page that an event happened on. Required for non-HubSpot pages.

hidden.description: Whether the option is displayed in HubSpot's UI.

displayOrder.description: The position of the item relative to others in the list.

label.description: A user-friendly label that identifies the option.

value.description: The actual value of the option.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

scopes.media_bridge.write: Create and update media and media events
